metadata.title: CVE-2023-50387 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4033, 4034, 4035, 6840,and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. Oneof the concerns is that, when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIGrecords, the protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluateall combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

criterions.comment: bind9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
unbound: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
dnsmasq: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
pdns-recursor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
knot-resolver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
